intro: Dalembertia triangularis, commonly known as the triangular dalembertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
